properties.prefix:
Research Site


  • There are specific field-sets for recommended aspects of description. The “type” sub-field is used to fine tune the meaning, the “value” sub-field is used to indicate a key-word or phrase for that aspect, and the “note” sub-field is used for a longer text which amplifies the meaning or indicates a special consideration.

  • If there is no specific field-set for your purpose, use “keyword” for typed descriptive words or phrases and “note” for typed descriptive texts.

properties.description: The required name, label or formal title of the research site being described. This is the primary way of naming this research site in the system.
properties.title: Primary Title

properties.description: Use this if there are other names or titles associated with the research site.
properties.title: Alternate Titles

properties.description: The type of alternate title such as Abbreviation.
properties.title: Alternate Title Type

properties.description: This is a general description or abstract about what you know about the research site in the context of your research.
properties.title: Summary Description

properties.description: Keywords, subject terms, key phrases classification codes, etc., ideally drawn from a thesaurus, which classifies or describes the research site and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Keywords

properties.description: The type of keyword, such as Subject, Geographic or Temporal. Leaving type blank would imply general keywords.
properties.title: Keyword Type

properties.description: Formal strings of characters that are used to uniquely identify the research site in various systems. This can also be used to create a formal identifier for the research site for your project.
properties.title: Identifiers

properties.description: The name of the system or standard for which the identifier was created.
properties.title: Identifier Type

properties.description: A standard identifier for the entity, e.g. ISSN, opus no., etc., or a URI.
properties.title: Identifier

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the identifier being described.
properties.title: Identifier Notes

properties.description: This is the statement of different kinds of rights that are asserted for the research site. This can include such things as access rights, credit lines, etc.
properties.title: Rights

properties.description: The type of rights such as Access or Use Rights.
properties.title: Rights Type

properties.description: A statement of the ownership and/or access rights associated with the research site.
properties.title: Rights

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the rights being described.
properties.title: Rights Notes

properties.description: Other entities that are related to the research site, such as the name of a larger research site or entity of which the research site being described is or was a part.
properties.title: Relations

properties.description: The type of Relationship such as Related Research Site.
properties.title: Relationship Type

properties.description: The name of the related entity.
properties.title: Related Entity

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the relationship being described.
properties.title: Relationship Notes

properties.description: General notes that provide descriptions for other aspects relevant to your understanding of the research site, and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Notes

properties.description: The type of note being described such as General or Historical Notes.
properties.title: Note Type

properties.description: This can be used to register specific dates associated with the research site, such as the time period it was under investigation, etc.
properties.title: Time Periods

properties.description: The type of time period such as “active”.
properties.title: Time Period Type

properties.description: A textual date such as a time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century" or "the Mesozoic era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A numeric date associated with the research site being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as Begin Date or End Date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: The spatial location of the site. This section can be used to describe the formal geometry of the research site being described, such as a central point, boundary box or polygon of points that define its boundary.
properties.title: Place Information

properties.description: The type of place being described such as, the Research Site Location.
properties.title: Place Type

properties.description: Name of a geographic location pertaining to the entity being described e.g. Country, Province, Region, etc.
properties.title: Geographic Areas

properties.description: This is used to identify the time period during which the geometry is relevant to the research site.
properties.title: Place Time Period

properties.description: The type of time period being described.
properties.title: Time Period Type

properties.description: A textual date such as a time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century" or "the Mesozoic era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as Begin Date or End Date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the place being described.
properties.title: Place Notes

properties.description: This is used to identify people or organizations that have a special relationship to the research site. For example, the person who managed the site or the site’s owner, or an organization that sponsored or funded work on that specific site.
properties.title: Related People and Organizations

properties.description: The role of the person related to the research site, such as “manager” or “owner”.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the person.
properties.title: Person Name

properties.description: The role of the organization related to the research site, such as “funder”.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the organization.
properties.title: Organization Name

properties.description: This is used to classify and/or describe the physical characteristics of a research site.
properties.title: Physical Description

properties.description: The type of characteristic being described.
properties.title: Physical Description Type

properties.description: The state or condition of the site, such as recently timbered or whether it was pristine or disturbed.
properties.title: Condition

properties.description: The type of the condition assessment, such as “current state”.
properties.title: Condition Type

properties.description: This is used to describe the background or larger surroundings of a research site.
properties.title: Context

properties.description: The type of context being described.
properties.title: Context Type

properties.description: This is a place to identify research methodologies that are used at the site.
properties.title: Methods

properties.description: The type of method being described.
properties.title: Method Type

properties.description: This is a place to identify research techniques that were used at the site.
properties.title: Technique

properties.description: The type of techniques used at the research site.
properties.title: Technique Type

properties.description: This can be used to classify or describe any special treatment of the site.
properties.title: Treatment

properties.description: The type of treatment being described.
properties.title: Treatment Type

properties.description: Either a textual or formal numeric description of the dimensions of a research site, such as area in square meters, meters above sea level, etc.
properties.title: Measurements

properties.description: A textual description of a measurement such as “L 12 inches; H 6 inches”.
properties.title: Measurement Text

properties.description: A measurement intended to be a single dimension using a combination of the type, value and units attributes.
properties.title: Numeric Measurements

properties.description: The type of measurement such as height, depth, circumference or number of components.
properties.title: Measurement Type

properties.description: The numeric value of the measurement.
properties.title: Measurement Value

properties.description: The unit of measurement such as inches, feet, centimeters, or components.
properties.title: Measurement Unit

properties.description: Dates pertaining to the measurements taken.
properties.title: Measurement Dates

properties.description: The type of date associated with the measurement.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A textual date such as a time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century" or "the Mesozoic era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A numeric date associated with the measurement being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as Begin or End date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Explanatory text on the accuracy of the set of measurements.
properties.title: Measurement Accuracy

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the measurement being described.
properties.title: Measurement Notes
